ValueDomain.preferredName: Subject Characteristics Test Code Subject Characteristics Original Result Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Outcome
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A character or string that represents the short code name of the subject characteristics test._The earliest outcome of the subject characteristics assessment._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A character or string that represents the short code name of the subject characteristics test.
The earliest outcome of the subject characteristics assessment.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]

ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 07.14.22_Released during quarterly metrics and per request from G. Riley_ghd

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., MARISTAT) or [TESTCD]_SCORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the SC test code e.g., MARISTAT_SCORRES. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SCORRES;SCTEST;SCTESTCD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable. In addition to the SDTMIG variable SCORRES, create the SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of SCTEST from SCTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the SCTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
